page.title: 17CONISHEAD PRIORY
page.content: This spectacular building started life in the 12th century when Gamel de Pennington found that the site was the safest in the area to make landings from the sea. In 1821 the Gothic mansion that stands today was built,its towers and battlements retaining the style of the earlier building. The interior has fine decorative plaster ceilings and wood panelling. The Priory is now the home of a religious order,the ORDER OF TIBETAN MAHAYANA BUDDHIST SCHOOL,whose monks are gradually restoring the building to its former splendours. Open to the public many afternoons, the Priory has a cafe and craft shop and offers weekend and one day seminars in a variety of subjects.
